column4: I think you can add and remove packages at the same time with aptitude's curses interface.
Try running "sudo aptitude" (with no install or remove arguments). You'll find documentation on how to navigate it in /usr/share/doc/aptitude/
thanks for the advice
To be on the safe side, prepend it with a relative path, ./, like you do when executing something in the current dir.
except that the python source that's firing off this source command likes to update itself and thus reset whatever workarounds i write into it
Huh? You're trying to source a sh script in python?
yeah, it's not my python code, it's from sidefx for houdini 10.0 hqueue client, and that's what they do
Why source it then? Why not just execute it?
Well, the proper thing to do in any case is to file a bug on it.

and in all honestly, i don't know what the difference between sourcing and executing a script is, but i want to get this work for now rather than waiting for sidefx to release their next version of houdini (which is probably not address this issue anyway)
Does it specify bash as shell? If not, it'll use sh, which does not understand «source», posix sh only has «.»
If it does specify bash, it should work if you add the dir containing houdini_setup to PATH

when it fails because the script to source isn't in the PATH, it prints out a line that says something like: "sh: 1: source: file not found" which led me to believe it was sh, but yeah, you're right, sh doesn't understand source
however, if i append . to path with the python line: os.environ["PATH"] = os.environ["PATH"] + ":.", then it all of a sudden works, so i wanted to make this change permanent
when executing commands from the shell, it doesn't search PATH recursively, right?
That's dangerous, I'd rather just add a ./ infront of houdini_setup
Not recursive, that's correct
but where would i add that? if i add it in the python source, it will reset when it auto-updates
Btw, the coders of that script has commited «bashism». You can read about that here: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DashAsBinSh
Then change it, and submit a patch to the developers, so it will auto-update "right" next time ;)
yep, i'll do that since we apparently have premium-level support...until then, gotta add "." to path or "/opt/HFS" (probably the option)
